title: Deploying Applications with Docker
excerpt: Learn how to containerize and deploy your applications using Docker.
content:
Docker simplifies the process of deploying applications by containerizing them, ensuring consistency across different environments. This guide will walk you through the basics of Docker and how to deploy your first containerized application.

## Installing Docker

Download and install Docker from the [official website](https://www.docker.com/get-started):

```bash
# For macOS
brew install --cask docker
```

## Writing a Dockerfile

A `Dockerfile` defines the environment for your application:

```dockerfile
FROM node:14

WORKDIR /app

COPY package*.json ./

RUN npm install

COPY . .

EXPOSE 3000

CMD ["npm", "start"]
```

## Building and Running the Container

Build your Docker image:

```bash
docker build -t my-app .
```

Run the container:

```bash
docker run -p 3000:3000 my-app
```

Docker ensures that your application runs the same way in development, testing, and production environments.
author: Michael Lee
